data.title: top 10 big real estate companies in kuwait
data.meta_description: big real estate companies in kuwait or Kuwait's real estate industry have witnessed tremendous growth in recent years, thanks to the efforts of several large
data.text:
big real estate companies in kuwait or Kuwait’s real estate industry have witnessed tremendous growth in recent years, thanks to the efforts of several large and reputable companies. In this article, we will take a closer look at some of Kuwait’s top real estate companies that have made significant contributions to the industry.

big real estate companies in kuwait

big real estate companies in kuwait have played a critical role in the growth and development of the country’s real estate industry. They are responsible for creating world-class residential and commercial properties and providing a range of real estate services.

These companies have a focus on mixed-use projects and sustainability, incorporating the latest technologies and design principles to create modern, eco-friendly properties. Their efforts have helped to create a unique and attractive real estate landscape in Kuwait, positioning it as a leading real estate market in the Middle East.

top 10 big real estate companies in kuwait

Kuwait’s real estate industry is home to several big players who have contributed significantly to the industry’s growth and development. Among them, we mention:

Mabanee

United Real Estate

Al Mazaya Holding Company

Tamdeen Group

National Real Estate Company (NREC)

Alargan International Real Estate Company

Al-Kharafi Global for Real Estate Development

Kuwait Real Estate Company (AQARAT)

Al Rai Real Estate Development Company

Dar Al-Arkan Kuwait Real Estate Company

Mabanee

Mabanee is a leading real estate development company that has earned a reputation for creating innovative mixed-use projects, residential communities, and commercial spaces. Its portfolio includes the acclaimed The Avenues, The Avenues Phase 4, and the upcoming The Avenues Riyadh. Mabanee’s projects are known for their exceptional design, luxurious finishes, and attention to detail.

United Real Estate

United Real Estate is one of the largest real estate companies in Kuwait that offers a comprehensive range of services to property owners and investors. These services include property management, investment, and development. The company has a diverse portfolio of residential, commercial, and hospitality properties and prides itself on delivering high-quality projects that exceed its client’s expectations.

Al Mazaya Holding Company

Al Mazaya Holding Company is a leading real estate developer that focuses on creating residential, commercial, and industrial properties in Kuwait and other countries in the Middle East. The company’s notable projects include the Mazaya Towers in Kuwait City and the Mazaya Business Avenue in Dubai. Al Mazaya Holding Company has earned a reputation for delivering high-quality projects that are both functional and aesthetically pleasing.

Tamdeen Group

Tamdeen Group is a leading real estate developer and operator that specializes in creating world-class shopping malls, leisure and entertainment destinations, and mixed-use projects. The company has developed several iconic projects in Kuwait, including The Al Kout Mall and 360 Mall. Tamdeen Group’s projects are known for their attention to detail, exceptional design, and unique features that make them stand out.

National Real Estate Company (NREC)

National Real Estate Company (NREC) is a real estate investment and development company that operates in Kuwait and other countries in the Middle East. The company’s focus is on developing residential, commercial, and hospitality properties that meet the needs of its clients. NREC has an impressive portfolio of projects, including the Burj Alshaya Complex in Kuwait City.

Kuwait real estate prices

According to recent reports, the average price per square meter for a residential property in Kuwait ranges from KD 300 to KD 1,200 (approximately USD 1,000 to USD 4,000), depending on the location and type of property. Luxury properties in prime locations can command even higher prices, with some villas and apartments selling for over KD 2 million (approximately USD 6.5 million).

Commercial property prices in Kuwait are also affected by location and type, with prime office space commanding higher prices than retail or industrial properties. The average price per square meter for commercial property in Kuwait ranges from KD 400 to KD 2,000 (approximately USD 1,300 to USD 6,500).

In conclusion, these big real estate companies in kuwait have played a vital role in shaping Kuwait’s real estate industry, providing high-quality properties, and a range of services to meet the needs of property owners and investors.
